Dispute_Type: Complaint of racial discrimination and harassment in the Canadian Armed Forces
Legal_Issue: Whether the Canadian Human Rights Commission's decision not to deal with the complaint under s 41(1)(a) of the Canadian Human Rights Act was reasonable
Governing_Law: Canadian Human Rights Act, s 41(1)(a) and s 42(2)
Evidence_Assessment: Applicant failed to participate in the Canadian Forces' harassment complaint process despite clear instructions and deadlines
Decision_Outcome: Commission's decision not to investigate upheld as reasonable
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate that exhaustion of internal remedies was not required or not attributable to complainant
Credibility_Factor: Applicant's argument about an 'endless loop' in procedures found unconvincing
Legal_Rule: Under s 41(1)(a), the Commission shall not deal with a complaint if other reasonably available grievance procedures exist and ought to be exhausted
Procedural_Issue: Failure to exhaust internal Canadian Forces harassment complaint process
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged racial discrimination by superior officer during service in Haiti in 2010
Outcome_on_Merits: Application dismissed; no investigation proceeded due to procedural inadmissibility
Review_Standard: Reasonableness of Commission’s interpretation and application of s 41(1)(a)
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Commission acted fairly by requiring use of established internal military processes
Key_Evidence_Considered: Instructions and deadlines provided to applicant; existence of Chief of Defence Staff-mandated harassment process
Legal_Framework: Administrative law, human rights law, military grievance procedures
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged Commission’s refusal to investigate based on non-exhaustion of internal remedies
Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities (implied in administrative context)
Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated, but Commission relied on procedural default by applicant
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of process instructions, procedural history
Remedy_Requested: Investigation of discrimination complaint by the Canadian Human Rights Commission
Outcome: Complaint not investigated due to failure to exhaust internal remedies
Remedy_Sought: Judicial review overturning Commission’s decision under s 41(1)(a)
Resolution_Mechanism: Internal Canadian Forces harassment complaint process
Legal_Provision: s 41(1)(a) and s 42(2) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Authority: Canadian Human Rights Commission, Federal Court on judicial review
Claimant_Status: Current or former member of the Canadian Armed Forces
Legal_Provision_Cited: s 41(1)(a), s 42(2), Canadian Human Rights Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to exhaust other reasonably available grievance procedures
Jurisdiction: Federal jurisdiction – Canadian Human Rights Commission and Federal Court
Governing_Rule: s 41(1)(a) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
